DynamicCourse.guide-alert-1-step:
To activate the dynamic course you need to create a survey.
Based on this survey, a dynamic course will be automatically created for each user.
DynamicCourse.guide-alert-2-step:
Create a new survey with questions.
Every question has an answer.
You can add rules for each answer.
Each rule determines whether to suggest or skip a lesson.
When the user conducts such a survey, the system based on the answer rules has the ability to prepare a dynamic course only with lessons that are more suited to the user's skill level.
DynamicCourse.guide-alert-3-step:
Add questions to the survey.
Then assign each answer to the lesson.
On this basis, the system will create a survey and decide which lessons will be shown to the user.
DynamicCourse.guide-alert-question:
Add question to the survey.
Then assign each answer to the rule.
On this basis, the system will create a survey and decide which lessons will be shown to the user in thier dynamic course.
DynamicCourse.guide-alert-rules:
Choose a rule for each answer.
Based on this rule, it will be determined which lesson is to be selected and added to the dynamic course after completing the survey.
DynamicCourse.delete-dynamic-course-confirmation: Are you sure you want to DELETE this dynamic course?

Survey.alert-first-step: On a scale of 0-3 (nothing, something, good, great), answer the questions that will determine your level of programming language knowledge.
Survey.alert-last-step: Based on your survey we found that these lessons are the best for you.

Survey.delete-survey-confirmation: Are you sure you want to DELETE this survey?
Survey.featured: Set as featured survey for a dynamic course for all users

KnowledgeTest.delete-knowledge-test: Delete knowledge test for this lesson
KnowledgeTest.guide-alert-1-step:
Knowledge test is a set of questions after lesson.
It is used to check the knowledge of the user after the lesson.
KnowledgeTest.guide-alert-2-step: Create a new knowledge test with questions.
KnowledgeTest.guide-alert-3-step:
Add questions with answers to the knowledge test.
Each question can have one correct answer.
KnowledgeTest.guide-alert-question:
Add question to the knowledge test.
Then add correct answer to the question.
KnowledgeTest.guide-alert-answer: Add correct answer to the question.
KnowledgeTest.global-guide-alert-1-step:
Global knowledge test is a set of questions from all lessons.
It is used to check the knowledge of the user and prepare a dynamic course for the user.
KnowledgeTest.global-guide-alert-2-step: Create a new global knowledge test with questions from all knowledge tests.
KnowledgeTest.global-guide-alert-3-step: Add questions to the global knowledge test.
KnowledgeTest.add-question-to-knowledge-test: Add question to the knowledge test
KnowledgeTest.alert-first-step:
Knowledge test is a set of questions after lesson.
It is used to check the knowledge of the user after the lesson.
KnowledgeTest.alert-first-step-global:
Global knowledge test is a set of questions from all lessons.
It is used to check the knowledge of the user and prepare a dynamic course for the user.
KnowledgeTest.knowledge-test-completed: You completed the knowledge test with score:
KnowledgeTest.alert-missing-knowledge:
Based on your results, you are missing some knowledge.
We created a course for you to learn the missing knowledge.
KnowledgeTest.delete-knowledge-test-confirmation: Are you sure you want to DELETE this knowledge test?
